comment.body:
Реклама блокируется корректно. Вероятно что-то не так с HTTPS фильтрацией. Какой сертификат показывается в браузере? Его можно посмотреть через настройки в адресной строке. Также проверить работу программы можно [здесь](https://adguard.com/test.html).
Можете также попробовать переустановить сертификат в настройках программы, проверить, что для `Chrome` выставлены настройки фильтрации в приложениях и также оставить только эти фильтры на время проверки.
```
AdGuard Base
AdGuard Mobile Ads
AdGuard URL Tracking
AdGuard Tracking Protection
AdGuard Social Media
AdGuard Cookie Notices
AdGuard Popups
AdGuard Mobile App Banners
AdGuard Other Annoyances
AdGuard Widgets
AdGuard Russian
```

comment.body:
Hi
Press on the 🛡️ icon at the bottom => `Safari protection` => `User rules`
You may add following rules to block twitter
```
||twitter.com^
||x.com^
```

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);

- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;

- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.19.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://tof.pwrd.co.kr/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Install the Tower of Fantasy game and add WmgpMobileGame.exe to https filtering. And when I run the game and log in, I can't log in with an error as shown in the picture below.

`@@||mapi.perfectworldgames.com/c/api/user/token/login$stealth=xclientdata`
The above rule solves the problem. Please reflect it in the filter.

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyList Germany, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. Screenshot 1:
### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Use either rule:
```
@@|pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js$domain=duden.de
duden.de#%#//scriptlet("set-constant", "handleUtilitiesChecking", "noopFunc")
||duden.de/utilities^
```

First rule is unblocking the checking request, 2nd one breaks their checking script (which they can rename of course) and third blocks their responsible script.

comment.body:
> Снова здравствуйте, после отправки вам про некорректную работу сайта, я отключал Защиту Safari чтобы отправить скриншот, сделал скриншот, создалась задача, включил Защиту Safari снова, обновил фильтры и теперь вылазит реклама будто я и не включал снова Защиту Safari

Попробуйте выключить/включить, и не переключаясь на другое приложение выждать полторы минуты. iOS убивает фоновые приложения после 30 секунд, и Адгард не успевает подготовить фильтры для Сафари.

comment.body:
>For the second time the issue is closed and still not resolved!! It has become very annoying. How many times do I need to report this issue until it is resolved?

As far as I can see, a new domain is used now `abda3.xyz` (previously it was `wisw.online`).
Every time when there is a new domain, then new rules have to been added (in this case a new domain to current rules).

If you see a new domain, you can add it to user rules to the rules like these:
```adblock
newdomain2.com,newdomain1.com,abda3.xyz#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'pagead2.googlesyndication.com')
newdomain2.com,newdomain1.com,abda3.xyz#%#//scriptlet('prevent-eval-if', '/fairAdblock|chp_?adblock|adsbygoogle\.js/')
newdomain2.com,newdomain1.com,abda3.xyz#%#//scriptlet('adjust-setInterval', '/proceed|mdtimer/', '*', '0.001')
```

comment.body: @kodiakhub I generally use ublock in the browser on PC. Its logger is much more successful than Adguard's. (Even if I allow the blocked link in the Adguard logger, it can remain blocked when I refresh the page. It comes back after a few tries, etc.) I allow the blocked script or url and see if the adblock warning goes away. It's like a trial and error method.  But after a certain experience, you see that it usually gives adblock warnings over similar script blocking. (_ima3.js_ - _pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js_ - _googletagmanager.com_ etc.) Of course, I can't do anything about the complex ones. My knowledge of scripts is very, very little.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/184282

comment.body:
It is the same certificate, if AdGuard is enabled or not.

![Screenshot 2024-11-15 163336](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/86edaf61-4504-476f-9fee-48ab35fa9000)

Does that mean that the AdGuard application does not work on most websites unless HTTPS filtering is enabled?
But the AdGuard AdBlock extension does?

I had my browser freak out about the certificate of a lot of websites with the HTTPS feature turned on, so I turned it off, and everything worked again.

![Screenshot 2024-11-15 164026](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a7a35ed9-1c6d-4949-8587-ed7fc593fa44)

So for me to safely use my banking website and exchange websites, can I turn off the HTTPS filtering with the AdGuard Assistant extension only for that site, if I choose to turn HTTPS filtering back on again?

It seems the AdGuard application only detects my default browser (Waterfox), all my other browsers like: Firefox, Chrome, Brave, Edge, does not seem to get listed even with the AdGuard Assistant extension installed in them.

![Screenshot 2024-11-15 164218](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6754877c-0032-4163-86e8-88f10aa8cd32)

I just wanna make sure my secure connection is not intercepted by the AdGuard application on banking services and the likes.

Thank you for looking into this.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/184282

issue.title: Get rid of localStorage.setItem rules
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

JS rules with `localStorage.setItem` must be checked and removed or converted to the scriptlet syntax.

### Proposed solution

Check if the rules are still required and convert/remove the rules.

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.title: m.winfuture.de

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://community.list-kr.com/docs/AdGuard/Userscripts/microShield.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/175394) if other issue.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
